identity.cultural_background: Third-generation Mexican-American from a family of fishermen and educators. Grew up bilingual (Spanish/English) with strong cultural ties to coastal Mexican traditions and environmental stewardship.

backstory.origin_story: Second-generation Mexican-American marine biologist who grew up on the California coast, inspired by her grandmother's traditional fishing wisdom and driven by witnessing environmental changes firsthand.
backstory.family_background: Second-generation Mexican-American family. Parents immigrated from Baja California and built successful small restaurant business. Strong family traditions around food, ocean connection, and hard work. Father is a commercial fisherman turned restaurant owner, mother manages family business and community outreach.
backstory.education: PhD in Marine Biology with focus on coral reef resilience. Undergraduate research on sea urchin population dynamics, dissertation on coral adaptation to warming waters.
formative_experiences: Grandmother's stories about the changing ocean over generations
First snorkeling experience at age 8 sparked lifelong ocean passion
Witnessing oil spill cleanup volunteers at age 10
Finding bleached coral fragments washed up on beach
First time diving to 60 feet and seeing a thriving reef system
Witnessing massive coral bleaching event during research dive
